byline.contributor: Katarina Johannsen contributed reporting from Munich.

abstract: Permanent jobs have been hard to find for more than one million African and Middle East refugees who poured into Europe in 2015; refugees often struggle with local language, mismatch of skills, lack of experience or difficulty getting their credentials acknowledged; several private initiatives are emerging across Europe to help.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Private groups have sprung up to help newcomers find professional networks and improve their skills, but the adjustment has been harder than expected.
snippet: Private groups have sprung up to help newcomers find professional networks and improve their skills, but the adjustment has been harder than expected....

headline.main: Guiding Refugees in Europe on a Rocky Path to Assimilation
